intro: Piriqueta mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Piriqueta mexicana is adapted to dry climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
